While it is often easier to search for resources using the search box on the top-right of the site or advanced search, it is also possible to browse resources in by a number of useful categories:

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: This resource has been made innaccessible until the specified problems are resolved.
There are no documents attached to this resource.

This tool allows you to instruct the system to regenerate the previews for this resource if they are incorrect or incomplete. This action ignores the indexer and is performed immediately, as a result this might take some time. If the preview still can't be created, please use the Contact Us botton at the bottom of the page.
Transferred ownership of this resource to .
Username must be a combination of letters and numbers.
Try to make your title concise, but also helpful and explanatory to other users. Avoid being too vague or too general. The title will be the first impression you give other users about your resource.
Enter a brief description of this resource.
Select an appropriate license for this resource. This repository allows Creative Commons licenses.
The person or people who made this resource. (Email address will not be shared).
Do you have any suggestions for how another user might reuse this resource in their teaching?
Individual words which describe the content of the resource. These help users understand what your resource is about at a glance.

epp:phrase.p: Separate each keyword with a comma: social networks, lecture, slides. Hit enter to add your keywords.

This interface allows you to email the uploader of this item without them having to give out their email address. Be considerate when emailing a person. Try to make emails clear and concise. By emailing this person you are giving them your email address as a way to reply. Please remember just because you have emailed the user does not mean they are oblidged to reply to you.

epp:phrase.p: from has contacted you about your resource: .
